review: Better than any of the other programming learning apps on Google play, much more access to much fuller content with much better pricing. The beginning python lessons are great, they don't breeze over topics as much as the later ones, which seem to give diminishing returns, the harder the topic. The lessons on function defs, (especially args and kwargs), Œªs, OOP, dictionaries, recursion, all need more exercises and more varied examples.
replyContent: Hello!Thanks for your feedback!We couldn‚Äôt help but notice that you have given Sololearn a four-star rating but left positive comments. If you want to send us additional feedback, please reach out to us at info@sololearn.com.We'd be very grateful if you would then update your review to reflect your experience.
standardizedReview: better programming learning apps google play much access much fuller content much better pricing beginning python lessons great dont breeze topics much later ones seem give diminishing returns harder topic lessons function defs especially args kwargs ls oop dictionaries recursion need exercises varied examples

review: An excellent app. Positively challenging and very rewarding. Have paid for yearly subscription and will pay for another to keep the momentum going. Have got my python for data science certificate after stopping and starting the course over several months and then pushing myself to stay up all last night to damn well get to the finish line, which I damn well did! I am now going to try and get some sleep before the sun rises. More courses to build upon my progress beckon. Will update..

review: I downloaded this app out of sheer desperation, since I had to learn c++ for my bachelor thesis and coding intimidates me. But this app delivers what it advertises. Its easier if you have some experience in another language (python, in my case) but if you practice enough at the beginnig, you'd catch up quickly. The only reason why I'm giving 4 stars and not 5, is because I feel like the option of 'for science' is missing. Where are my vectors and matrixes?!

review: It's ALMOST a perfect app for learning. I'm tempted to give it a 3 star but it's really a 3.5 Major improvements it NEEDS are: 1) Practice problems for ALL courses instead of just some. Especially for PHP. 2) Some courses have sections that need to be split into several. Namely css animations. 3) They provide multiple python courses covering different topics in python, they should do the same for other languages. Beginner intermediate and advanced? I really want PHP practice problems though.

Other than that it has been a really excellent and helpful course and I am happy I went pro.

review: Very enjoyable and user friendly way to learn the basics onward through advanced programming. Having said all this though, I've seen, both personally and from the community, that the swift and python lessons are lacking greatly in regard to clear explanation/instruction making it incredibly difficult to enjoy, nonetheless actually learn- just view the comment area in any of these lesson sections, you'll notice person after person leaving comments which express confusion in varying degrees, myself included... Its very discouraging to want to continue "learning" via sololearn when the way they provide assists so well in learning  other languages, yet for python and swift, myself and hundreds of others all of a sudden don't get it. Its obviously not just me, perhaps sololearn isn't adequate for "teaching" certain language
